00036 char* mystrcat(char* dest, char* src)

00052 char *rule2string(ruleobj *rule, int rulelength)
00053 {
00054     int temp = 0, i;
00055     for (i = 0; i < rulelength; i++)
00056         temp += rule[i].len;
00057 
00058     char *str = (char *)malloc(temp + 1);
00059     char *_str = str;
00060 
00061     for (i = 0; i < rulelength; i++)
00062     {
00063         _str = mystrcat(_str, rule[i].str);
00064     }
00065 
00066     return str;
00067 }

00069 
00079 double fastsqrt (double y) {
00080     double x, z, tempf;
00081     unsigned long *tfptr = ((unsigned long *)&tempf) + 1;
00082 
00083     tempf = y;
00084     *tfptr = (0xbfcdd90a - *tfptr)>>1; /* estimate of 1/sqrt(y) */
00085     x =  tempf;
00086     z =  y*0.5;                        /* hoist out the "/2"    */
00087     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);         /* iteration formula     */
00088     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00089     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00090     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00091     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00092     return x*y;
00093 }

00108 int extract_number(char *str, char *result, int result_size)
00109 {
00110     int n = 0;
00111 
00112     while ( (n < result_size-1) &&
00113             ( ((*str <= '9') && (*str >= '0')) || (*str == '.') || (*str == 'Q') || (*str == 'I'))
00114           )
00115     {
00116         result[n] = *str;
00117         n++;
00118         str++;
00119     }
00120     result[n] = '\0';
00121     return n;
00122 }

00136 ruleobj *string2rule(char *s, int *rulelength)
00137 {
00138     ruleobj *rule, *temprule, *ret_rule;
00139     double num;
00140     char numstr[7];
00141     int count = 0, s_len, temp_num;
00142 
00143     s_len = strlen(s);
00144     rule = (ruleobj *)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj)*s_len);
00145     temprule = rule;
00146 
00147     while (*s)
00148     {
00149         if (*s == 'F')
00150         {
00151             temprule->str[0] = 'F';
00152             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00153             temprule->len = 1;
00154             temprule->type = F;
00155         }
00156         else if (*s == 'G')
00157         {
00158             temprule->str[0] = 'G';
00159             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00160             temprule->len = 1;
00161             temprule->type = G;
00162         }
00163         else if (*s == '+')
00164         {
00165             temprule->str[0] = '+';
00166             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00167             temprule->len = 1;
00168             temprule->type = INC;
00169         }
00170         else if (*s == '-')
00171         {
00172             temprule->str[0] = '-';
00173             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00174             temprule->len = 1;
00175             temprule->type = DEC;
00176         }
00177         else if (*s == '!')
00178         {
00179             temprule->str[0] = '!';
00180             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00181             temprule->len = 1;
00182             temprule->type = REV;
00183         }
00184         else if (*s == '\\')
00185         {
00186             temprule->str[0] = '\\';
00187             temp_num = extract_number(s+1, temprule->str+1, 7);
00188             s += temp_num;
00189             temprule->len = temp_num + 1;
00190             temprule->type = INCX;
00191         }
00192         else if (*s == '/')
00193         {
00194             temprule->str[0] = '/';
00195             temp_num = extract_number(s+1, temprule->str+1, 7);
00196             s += temp_num;
00197             temprule->len = temp_num + 1;
00198             temprule->type = DECX;
00199         }
00200         else if (*s == '@')
00201         {
00202             temprule->str[0] = '@';
00203             temp_num = extract_number(s+1, temprule->str+1, 7);
00204             s += temp_num;
00205             temprule->len = temp_num + 1;
00206             temprule->type = SCALE;
00207         }
00208         else if (*s == 'D')
00209         {
00210             temprule->str[0] = 'D';
00211             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00212             temprule->len = 1;
00213             temprule->type = D;
00214         }
00215         else if (*s == 'M')
00216         {
00217             temprule->str[0] = 'M';
00218             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00219             temprule->len = 1;
00220             temprule->type = MM;
00221         }
00222         else if (*s == '[')
00223         {
00224             temprule->str[0] = '[';
00225             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00226             temprule->len = 1;
00227             temprule->type = PUSH;
00228         }
00229         else if (*s == ']')
00230         {
00231             temprule->str[0] = ']';
00232             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00233             temprule->len = 1;
00234             temprule->type = POP;
00235         }
00236         else if ((*s >= 'A') && (*s <= 'Z'))
00237         {
00238             temprule->str[0] = *s;
00239             temprule->str[1] = '\0';
00240             temprule->len = 1;
00241             temprule->type = RULE;
00242         }
00243         else
00244         {
00245             temprule--;
00246             count--;
00247         }
00248         s++;
00249         temprule++;
00250         count++;
00251     }
00252 
00253     /* Now we know the number of 'units' in this rule. */
00254     *rulelength = count;
00255     ret_rule = (ruleobj *)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj)*count);
00256     int i;
00257     for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
00258     {
00259         mystrcat(ret_rule[i].str, rule[i].str);
00260         ret_rule[i].len = rule[i].len;
00261         ret_rule[i].type = rule[i].type;
00262     }
00263     free(rule);
00264     return ret_rule;
00265 }

00269 void print_ls(const lsystem *ls)
00270 {
00271     if (ls->computed_f)
00272         printf("Fitness: %f\n", ls->f);
00273     else
00274         printf("Fitness not computed\n");
00275 
00276 
00277     printf("Angle: %d\n", ls->angle);
00278 
00279     char *str = rule2string(ls->rule[0], ls->rulelength[0]);
00280     printf("Axiom: %s\n", str);
00281     free(str);
00282 
00283     int i;
00284     for (i = 1; i < ls->numrules; i++)
00285     {
00286         str = rule2string(ls->rule[i], ls->rulelength[i]);
00287         printf("%c -> %s\n", ls->startvar[i-1], str);
00288         free(str);
00289     }
00290 }

00299 lsystem *create_ls(const int num_rules, const int rule_length)
00300 {
00301     lsystem *ls;
00302     ls = (lsystem *)malloc(sizeof(lsystem));
00303     /* The extra rule is the axiom. */
00304     ls->numrules = num_rules + 1;
00305     ls->angle = 3;
00306 
00307     ls->rule = (ruleobj **)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj *) * ls->numrules);
00308     ls->startvar = (char *)malloc(sizeof(char) * (ls->numrules - 1));
00309 
00310     int i;
00311     ls->rulelength = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int) * ls->numrules);
00312     for (i = 0; i < ls->numrules; i++)
00313     {
00314         ls->rule[i] = (ruleobj *)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj) * rule_length);
00315         ls->rulelength[i] = rule_length;
00316     }
00317 
00318     ls->computed_f = 0;
00319 
00320     return ls;
00321 }

00325 void delete_ls(lsystem *ls)
00326 {
00327     int i, j;
00328     for (i = 0; i < ls->numrules; i++)
00329         free(ls->rule[i]);
00330     free(ls->rule);
00331     free(ls->rulelength);
00332     free(ls->startvar);
00333     free(ls);
00334 }

00338 void runningtime(char *filename, double *runtime, int *numbbnodes) {
00339     /* Create and open a pipe to the concorde program. */
00340     FILE *concorde_pipe;
00341     char *command;
00342     asprintf(&command, "concorde -s 0 %s", filename);
00343     concorde_pipe = popen(command, "r");
00344     if (concorde_pipe == NULL)
00345     {
00346         fprintf(stderr, "Could not open concorde pipe\n");
00347         exit(1);
00348     }
00349 
00350     int nbytes = 810;
00351     char *concorde_output = (char *)malloc(nbytes + 1), *pos;
00352     int bytesread;
00353 
00354     /* Run concorde and get the output */
00355     double rtime = 0;
00356     int bbnodes = 0;
00357     bytesread = getdelim(&concorde_output, &nbytes, "\n\n", concorde_pipe);
00358 
00359     /* I could have used my own timer, but the Concorde program already
00360        outputs this information. So I decided to use their definition of
00361        Concorde's running time.                                          */
00362 
00363     /* If there is no '?' in the output, something went wrong. Since we're
00364        only interested in instances that make it work (and are difficult for it)
00365        we will return 0 and so it has a weak fitness value.                      */
00366     pos = strchr(concorde_output, '?');
00367     if (pos != NULL)
00368         rtime = strtod(pos+1, NULL);
00369 
00370     pos = strchr(concorde_output, '&');
00371     if (pos != NULL)
00372         bbnodes = (int)strtol(pos+1, NULL, 10);
00373 
00374     if (pclose(concorde_pipe) == -1)
00375     {
00376         fprintf(stderr, "Could not close concorde pipe\n");
00377     }
00378     free(concorde_output);
00379 
00380     *runtime = rtime;
00381     *numbbnodes = bbnodes;
00382 }

00395 void createTSPFiles(char ***filenames, lsystem *ls)
00396 {
00397     char **fnames = (char **)malloc(sizeof(char *)*NUM_ORDER_TEST);
00398 
00399     int i, numnodes;
00400     printf("\nInstance Sizes: ");
00401     for (i = 0; i < NUM_ORDER_TEST; i++)
00402     {
00403         asprintf(&fnames[i], "plot_%d", i+1);
00404         savetofile(ls, "temp.l", "temp", NULL);
00405 
00406         /* Compute the x-y coordinates of the instance represented by this L-System. */
00407         numnodes = Lsystem(i + 1,"temp.l", "temp", "plots");
00408         ls->instancesize[i] = numnodes;
00409         printf("%d\t", numnodes);
00410 
00411         /* Now create a valid TSPlib file. */
00412         FILE *outfile_stream = fopen(fnames[i], "w");
00413 
00414         /* Check that the file has sucessfully been opened */
00415         if (outfile_stream == NULL)
00416         {
00417             printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be opened\n", fnames[i]);
00418             return;
00419         }
00420 
00421         /* Build the header file */
00422         fprintf(outfile_stream, "NAME: %s\n", fnames[i]);
00423         fprintf(outfile_stream, "TYPE: TSP\n");
00424         fprintf(outfile_stream, "COMMENT: Created by Farhan Ahammed (farhan.ahammed@studentmail.newcastle.edu.au)\n");
00425         fprintf(outfile_stream, "DIMENSION: %d\n", numnodes);
00426         fprintf(outfile_stream, "EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE: EUC_2D\n");
00427         fprintf(outfile_stream, "NODE_COORD_TYPE: TWOD_COORDS\n");
00428         fprintf(outfile_stream, "NODE_COORD_SECTION:\n");
00429 
00430         /* Add the coordinates of the points in this instance. */
00431         FILE *nodefile = fopen("plots", "r");
00432         char line[255];
00433         while(fgets(line, 255, nodefile) != NULL)
00434         {
00435             fprintf(outfile_stream, "%s", line);
00436         }
00437         fclose(nodefile);
00438         remove("plots");
00439         remove("temp.l");
00440 
00441         fprintf(outfile_stream, "EOF:\n");
00442 
00443         /* Close the file */
00444         int close_error_plot = fclose(outfile_stream);
00445         if (close_error_plot)
00446         {
00447             printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be closed\n", fnames[i]);
00448         }
00449     }
00450 
00451     printf("\n");
00452 
00453     (*filenames) = fnames;
00454 }

00456 
00467 double fitness(lsystem *ls)
00468 {
00469     if (ls->computed_f)
00470     {
00471         return ls->f;
00472     }
00473     ls->f = 0;
00474 
00475     /* Create the TSPlib files. */
00476     char **filenames;
00477     createTSPFiles(&filenames, ls);
00478 
00479     print_ls(ls);
00480 
00481     int i, j, bb;
00482     int size = NUM_ORDER_TEST;
00483     data_point points[size];
00484     double rt, n, mean, S, delta;
00485     for (i = 0; i < NUM_ORDER_TEST; i++)
00486     {
00487         points[i].x = ls->instancesize[i];
00488         ls->avgbbnodes[i] = 0;
00489         printf("size: %.0f\n", points[i].x);
00490 
00491 
00492         points[i].y = 0;
00493         /* Run each instance twice and take the average.
00494            Instances with large sizes take too long to solve and I am more
00495            interested in the smaller sized instances anyway.               */
00496         if (points[i].x > 1500)
00497         {
00498             points[i].y = 0;
00499             printf("Size too large (> 1500 cities)\n");
00500         }
00501         else
00502         {
00503             n = mean = S = 0;
00504             for (j = 0; j < NUM_TSP_ITER; j++)
00505             {
00506                 runningtime(filenames[i], &rt, &bb);
00507                 ls->avgbbnodes[i] += (double)bb;
00508                 printf("RT%2d: %0.4f\tBB: %d\n", j+1, rt, bb);
00509 
00510                 /* This calculation is used to compute the standard deviation. */
00511                 n++;
00512                 delta = rt - mean;
00513                 mean += delta/n;
00514                 S += delta*(rt - mean); /* NOTE: This expression uses the new value of mean. */
00515             }
00516             points[i].y = mean;
00517             ls->runningtimes[i] = points[i].y;
00518             ls->avgbbnodes[i] /= NUM_TSP_ITER;
00519             printf("\nAVG: %0.4f(%0.4f)\n", ls->runningtimes[i], ls->avgbbnodes[i]);
00520 
00521             S = S/(n - 1);
00522             ls->sd[i] = fastsqrt(S);
00523             printf("SD:  %0.4f\n", ls->sd[i]);
00524             printf("68%% lies within:  (%7.4f, %7.4f)\n", ls->runningtimes[i] - ls->sd[i], ls->runningtimes[i] + ls->sd[i]);
00525             printf("95%% lies within:  (%7.4f, %7.4f)\n", ls->runningtimes[i] - 2*(ls->sd[i]), ls->runningtimes[i] + 2*(ls->sd[i]));
00526         }
00527 
00528         printf("\n");
00529         free(filenames[i]);
00530     }
00531     free(filenames);
00532     system("rm -f Oplot* plot*");
00533 
00534 
00535     for (i = 0; i < NUM_ORDER_TEST; i++)
00536     {
00537         if (ls->instancesize[i] == ls->instancesize[i-1])
00538         {
00539             ls->computed_f = 1;
00540             ls->f = 0;
00541             printf("Some instance sizes are the same!!\n");
00542             printf("fitness: %f\n", ls->f);
00543             return ls->f;
00544         }
00545     }
00546 
00547     i = 0;
00548     while ((points[i].x < 100) || (points[i].y == 0)) i++;
00549     int offset = i-1;
00550 
00551     /* We might not like too many (x,0) points, but we need to have at least
00552        three points to compute the upper bound. */
00553     if (size - offset < 3) offset = size - 3;
00554 
00555     /* Compute the upper bound of the running times of the plots of different sizes. */
00556     double func[5];
00557     find_upper_bound(func, points + offset, size - offset);
00558 
00559     /* Compute the sum of errors. */
00560     double se = sum_error(func, points + offset, size - offset);
00561 
00562     /* We want to maximise 'func[0]' and minimise 'se'. */
00563     /* TODO: Incorporate all the ls->numbbnodes[i] into the fitness function. */
00564     ls->f = (func[0]*func[0])/(se+1);
00565     ls->computed_f = 1;
00566 
00567     printf("UB y =  %0.3f + %0.3f((x - %0.3f)/%0.3f)^(%0.6f)\n", func[2], func[4], func[1], func[3], func[0]);
00568     printf("SE: %f\n", se);
00569     printf("fitness: %f\n", ls->f);
00570 
00571     return ls->f;
00572 }

00575 
00576 int compare_ls(lsystem **ls1, lsystem **ls2)
00577 {
00578     double ls1_value = fitness(*ls1);
00579     double ls2_value = fitness(*ls2);
00580 
00581     if (ls1_value == ls2_value)
00582         return 0;
00583     if (ls1_value > ls2_value)
00584         return -1;
00585     else
00586         return 1;
00587 }

00597 void randomObj(ruleobj *robj, lsystem *ls)
00598 {
00599     int randangle, randrule;
00600     double randnum;
00601     int objtype = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%9);
00602 
00603     switch (objtype)
00604     {
00605         case 0:
00606             robj->str[0] = 'F';
00607             robj->str[1] = '\0';
00608             robj->len = 1;
00609             robj->type = F;
00610             break;
00611 
00612         case 1:
00613             robj->str[0] = 'G';
00614             robj->str[1] = '\0';
00615             robj->len = 1;
00616             robj->type = G;
00617             break;
00618 
00619         case 2:
00620             robj->str[0] = '+';
00621             robj->str[1] = '\0';
00622             robj->len = 1;
00623             robj->type = INC;
00624             break;
00625 
00626         case 3:
00627             robj->str[0] = '-';
00628             robj->str[1] = '\0';
00629             robj->len = 1;
00630             robj->type = DEC;
00631             break;
00632 
00633         case 4:
00634             robj->str[0] = '!';
00635             robj->str[1] = '\0';
00636             robj->len = 1;
00637             robj->type = REV;
00638             break;
00639 
00640         case 5:
00641             /* Generate a random number within the range (1,359) */
00642             randangle = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%359) + 1;
00643             sprintf(robj->str, "\\%03d", randangle);
00644             robj->len = 4;
00645             robj->type = INCX;
00646             break;
00647 
00648         case 6:
00649             /* Generate a random number within the range (1,359) */
00650             randangle = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%359ul) + 1;
00651             sprintf(robj->str, "/%03d", randangle);
00652             robj->len = 4;
00653             robj->type = DECX;
00654             break;
00655 
00656         case 7:
00657             /* Generate a random number within the range (0,10) */
00658             randnum = genrand_real3(&rng);
00659             /* Make sure the number doesn't get rounded down to 0.00 or up to 10.00 */
00660             if (randnum < 0.005) randnum = 0.01;
00661             if (randnum > 9.994) randnum = 9.99;
00662             sprintf(robj->str, "@%04.2f", randnum);
00663             robj->len = 5;
00664             robj->type = SCALE;
00665             break;
00666 
00667         case 8:
00668             randrule = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%(ls->numrules-1));
00669             robj->str[0] = ls->startvar[randrule];
00670             robj->str[1] = '\0';
00671             robj->len = 1;
00672             robj->type = RULE;
00673             break;
00674     }
00675 }
00676 
00677 
00678 void random_angle(lsystem *ls)
00679 {
00680     ls->angle = (int)genrand_int32(&rng)%(48UL) + 3;
00681 }
00682 
00683 
00684 void random_rule(lsystem *ls, int rule)
00685 {
00686     int i;
00687     for (i = 0; i < ls->rulelength[rule]; i++)
00688     {
00689         randomObj(&(ls->rule[rule][i]), ls);
00690     }
00691 
00692     /* We'll make it a one in NUM_OBJ_TYPES chance of placing a stack. */
00693     int rolldie = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%(long)NUM_OBJ_TYPES);
00694     if (!rolldie)
00695     {
00696         unsigned long pos1 = genrand_int32(&rng)%(ls->rulelength[rule]);
00697         unsigned long pos2 = genrand_int32(&rng)%(ls->rulelength[rule]);
00698 
00699         unsigned long start = (pos1 < pos2 ? pos1 : pos2);
00700         unsigned long end   = (pos1 < pos2 ? pos2 : pos1);
00701         /* Can't be the same or next to each other */
00702         if ((end - start) > 1)
00703         {
00704             ls->rule[rule][start].str[0] = '[';
00705             ls->rule[rule][start].str[1] = '\0';
00706             ls->rule[rule][start].len = 1;
00707             ls->rule[rule][start].type = PUSH;
00708 
00709             ls->rule[rule][end].str[0] = ']';
00710             ls->rule[rule][end].str[1] = '\0';
00711             ls->rule[rule][end].len = 1;
00712             ls->rule[rule][end].type = POP;
00713         }
00714     }
00715 
00716     /* We should avoid the situation where this rule has no A,B,C ... etc
00717        otherwise the L-System may not grow after each iteration. */
00718     int randpos = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%ls->rulelength[rule]);
00719     if ((ls->rule[rule][randpos].type == PUSH) || (ls->rule[rule][randpos].type == POP))
00720         if (randpos == 0)
00721             randpos++;
00722         else
00723             randpos--;
00724 
00725     int randrule = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%(ls->numrules-1));
00726     ls->rule[rule][randpos].str[0] = ls->startvar[randrule];
00727     ls->rule[rule][randpos].str[1] = '\0';
00728     ls->rule[rule][randpos].len = 1;
00729     ls->rule[rule][randpos].type = RULE;
00730 }
00731 
00732 
00733 
00734 void crossover_ls(const lsystem *p1, const lsystem *p2, lsystem *c1, lsystem *c2)
00735 {
00736     /* Iterate over the rules. */
00737     int i, j, pos1, pos2, length1, length2, foundStackStart, foundStackEnd;
00738     for (i = 0; i < c1->numrules; i++)
00739     {
00740         /* Randomly select a crossover point. */
00741         pos1 = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%(p1->rulelength[i]));
00742         pos2 = (int)(genrand_int32(&rng)%(p2->rulelength[i]));
00743 
00744         /* We cannot split a stack section. */
00745         j = pos1;
00746         foundStackStart = 0;
00747         foundStackEnd = 0;
00748         while ((j > 0) && (!foundStackEnd) && (!foundStackStart))
00749         {
00750             j--;
00751             if (p1->rule[i][j].type == POP)
00752                 foundStackEnd = 1;
00753             if (p1->rule[i][j].type == PUSH)
00754             {
00755                 foundStackStart = 1;
00756             }
00757         }
00758 
00759         if (foundStackStart)
00760         {
00761             /* Find where the stack ends. */
00762             j = pos1-1;
00763             while ((j < p1->rulelength[i]) && (!foundStackEnd))
00764             {
00765                 j++;
00766                 if (p1->rule[i][j].type == POP)
00767                     foundStackEnd = 1;
00768             }
00769             pos1 = j+1;
00770         }
00771 
00772 
00773         /* Again for the second child/rule, we cannot split a stack section. */
00774         j = pos2;
00775         foundStackStart = 0;
00776         foundStackEnd = 0;
00777         while ((j > 0) && (!foundStackEnd) && (!foundStackStart))
00778         {
00779             j--;
00780             if (p2->rule[i][j].type == POP)
00781                 foundStackEnd = 1;
00782             if (p2->rule[i][j].type == PUSH)
00783                 foundStackStart = 1;
00784         }
00785 
00786         if (foundStackStart)
00787         {
00788             /* Find where the stack ends. */
00789             j = pos2-1;
00790             while ((j < p2->rulelength[i]) && (!foundStackEnd))
00791             {
00792                 j++;
00793                 if (p2->rule[i][j].type == POP)
00794                     foundStackEnd = 1;
00795             }
00796             pos2 = j+1;
00797         }
00798 
00799         /* Based on the crosover points, we now know what will be the lengths of
00800            the two new rules that will be created.                               */
00801         length1 = pos1 + (p2->rulelength[i] - pos2);
00802         length2 = pos2 + (p1->rulelength[i] - pos1);
00803 
00804         /* Remove the old rules and replace them with new ones. */
00805         c1->rulelength[i] = length1;
00806         free(c1->rule[i]);
00807         c1->rule[i] = (ruleobj *)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj) * length1);
00808 
00809         c2->rulelength[i] = length2;
00810         free(c2->rule[i]);
00811         c2->rule[i] = (ruleobj *)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj) * length2);
00812 
00813         /* Now create the new rules. */
00814         memcpy(c1->rule[i], p1->rule[i], pos1*sizeof(ruleobj));
00815         memcpy(c1->rule[i] + pos1, p2->rule[i] + pos2, (length1 - pos1)*sizeof(ruleobj));
00816 
00817         memcpy(c2->rule[i], p2->rule[i], pos2*sizeof(ruleobj));
00818         memcpy(c2->rule[i] + pos2, p1->rule[i] + pos1, (length2 - pos2)*sizeof(ruleobj));
00819     }
00820 
00821     /* Inherit the angle values.
00822        TODO: Change this part to something better. The values aren't exactly evolving. */
00823     c1->angle = p1->angle;
00824     c2->angle = p2->angle;
00825 
00826     c1->computed_f = 0;
00827     c2->computed_f = 0;
00828 }
00829

00831 
00832 
00833 void savetofile(lsystem *ls, char *filename, char *lsname, char *comments)
00834 {
00835     /* Create a new ls file */
00836     FILE *outfile_stream = fopen(filename, "a");
00837 
00838     /* Store the fitness value of this iterated function system. */
00839     if (ls->computed_f)
00840         fprintf(outfile_stream, "; Fitness: %f\n", ls->f);
00841     else
00842         fprintf(outfile_stream, "; Fitness not computed\n");
00843 
00844     /* Store (in a commented line) the size of each plot size tested. */
00845     int i;
00846     fprintf(outfile_stream, ";\n; Instance Sizes:\n;");
00847     for (i = 0; i < NUM_ORDER_TEST; i++)
00848         fprintf(outfile_stream, " %d", ls->instancesize[i]);
00849     fprintf(outfile_stream, "\n");
00850 
00851     /* Store (in a commented line) the times taken for each plot size tested. */
00852     fprintf(outfile_stream, ";\n; Running Times:\n;");
00853     for (i = 0; i < NUM_ORDER_TEST; i++)
00854         fprintf(outfile_stream, " %f", ls->runningtimes[i]);
00855     fprintf(outfile_stream, "\n");
00856 
00857     /* Store (in a commented line) the upper bound on the running times. */
00858     fprintf(outfile_stream, ";\n; Running Times bounded above by:\n;");
00859     data_point points[NUM_ORDER_TEST];
00860     for (i = 0; i < NUM_ORDER_TEST; i++)
00861     {
00862         points[i].x = ls->instancesize[i];
00863         points[i].y = ls->runningtimes[i];
00864     }
00865     double func[5];
00866     find_upper_bound(func, points, NUM_ORDER_TEST);
00867     fprintf(outfile_stream, " t(n) = %f((n - %f)/%f)^(%f) + %f\n", func[4], func[1], func[3], func[0], func[2]);
00868 
00869 
00870     /* Store any additional comments */
00871     char *str, *newlinepos, *prevlinepos;
00872     int length;
00873     if (comments != NULL)
00874     {
00875         char *comments2;
00876         comments2 = (char *)malloc(sizeof(char)*strlen(comments));
00877         strcpy(comments2, comments);
00878 
00879         /* Get the first line. */
00880         newlinepos = strchr(comments2, '\n');
00881         if (newlinepos == NULL)
00882         {
00883             /* Get the remainder of the line. */
00884             newlinepos = strchr(comments2, '\0');
00885         }
00886         prevlinepos = comments2;
00887 
00888         /* Use the positions of where our line starts and ends to find the length
00889            of the string.                                                         */
00890         length = newlinepos - prevlinepos;
00891 
00892         do
00893         {
00894             /* Get a copy of the substring (i.e. the next line). */
00895             str = (char *)malloc(sizeof(char)*length + 1);
00896             strncpy(str, prevlinepos, length);
00897             str[length] = '\0';
00898 
00899             /* Print the next line to the file. */
00900             fprintf(outfile_stream, "; %s\n", str);
00901             free(str);
00902 
00903             /* Get the 'next line'. That is, start from the position after the '\n'.*/
00904             prevlinepos = newlinepos + 1;
00905             newlinepos = strchr(prevlinepos, '\n');
00906 
00907             if (newlinepos == NULL)
00908             {
00909                 /* Get the remainder of the line. */
00910                 newlinepos = strchr(comments2, '\0');
00911             }
00912 
00913             /* Use the positions where our line starts and ends to find the length
00914                of the string.                                                      */
00915             length = newlinepos - prevlinepos;
00916         } while (length >= 0);
00917 
00918         free(comments2);
00919     }
00920 
00921     /* Store the L-System to file. */
00922     fprintf(outfile_stream, "%s {\n", lsname);
00923     fprintf(outfile_stream, "Angle %d\n", ls->angle);
00924 
00925     char *tempstr = rule2string(ls->rule[0], ls->rulelength[0]);
00926     fprintf(outfile_stream, "Axiom %s\n", tempstr);
00927     free(tempstr);
00928 
00929     for (i = 1; i < ls->numrules; i++)
00930     {
00931         tempstr = rule2string(ls->rule[i], ls->rulelength[i]);
00932         fprintf(outfile_stream, "%c=%s\n", ls->startvar[i-1], tempstr);
00933         free(tempstr);
00934     }
00935     fprintf(outfile_stream, "}\n\n\n");
00936 
00937     /* Close the file */
00938     int close_error_func = fclose(outfile_stream);
00939     if (close_error_func)
00940     {
00941         printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be closed\n", filename);
00942     }
00943 }
00944 
00945 
00946 #define LINE_LENGTH 160
00947 
00954 int numLSystemsInFile(FILE *fp)
00955 {
00956     int count = 0;
00957     char line[LINE_LENGTH], *temp, *delims = " \t\n";
00958 
00959     rewind(fp);
00960     while (fgets(line, LINE_LENGTH, fp) != NULL)
00961     {
00962         if (line[0] != ';') /* Ignore comments. */
00963         {
00964             /* See if we've reached the end. */
00965             if (strchr(line, '}')) count++;
00966         }
00967     }
00968     rewind(fp);
00969     return count;
00970 }
00971 
00972 
00980 void readLSystem(FILE *fp, lsystem *ls)
00981 {
00982     int rulecount = 0, m, n, i=1;
00983     char line[LINE_LENGTH], *temp, *delims = " :;=\t\n", rule[LINE_LENGTH], c;
00984 
00985     fpos_t file_loc;
00986     fgetpos(fp, &file_loc);
00987 
00988     while (fgets(line, LINE_LENGTH, fp) != NULL)
00989     {
00990         if (line[0] != ';') /* Ignore comments. */
00991         {
00992             /* See if this line has a rule. */
00993             if (temp = strchr(line, '='))
00994             {
00995                 /* Check that the rule is non-empty */
00996                 if (*++temp != '\n')
00997                     rulecount++;
00998             }
00999             /* See if we've reached the end. */
01000             if (strchr(line, '}')) break;
01001         }
01002     }
01003     /* The extra rule is the axiom. */
01004     ls->numrules = rulecount + 1;
01005     ls->rule = (ruleobj **)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj *) * ls->numrules);
01006     ls->startvar = (char *)malloc(sizeof(char) * (ls->numrules - 1));
01007     ls->rulelength = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int) * ls->numrules);
01008 
01009     fsetpos(fp, &file_loc);
01010     while (fgets(line, LINE_LENGTH, fp) != NULL)
01011     {
01012         /* We Ignore comments by replacing the first ';' with NULL.
01013            This way the string terminates before the comments start. */
01014         temp = strchr(line, ';');
01015         if (temp != NULL) *temp = '\0';
01016 
01017         strupr(line);
01018         temp = strtok(line, delims);
01019         if (temp != NULL)
01020         {
01021             if (!strcmp(temp, "ANGLE"))
01022             {
01023                 temp = strtok(NULL, delims);
01024                 ls->angle = (int)strtol(temp, NULL, 10);
01025             }
01026             else if (!strcmp(temp, "AXIOM"))
01027             {
01028                 temp = strtok(NULL, delims);
01029                 ls->rule[0] = (ruleobj *)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj) * n);
01030                 ls->rule[0] = string2rule(temp, &n);
01031                 ls->rulelength[0] = n;
01032             }
01033             else
01034             {
01035                 /* We're analysing a rule. */
01036                 c = temp[0];
01037                 temp = strtok(NULL, delims);
01038                 if (temp != NULL)
01039                 {
01040                     ls->startvar[i-1] = c;
01041                     ls->rule[i] = (ruleobj *)malloc(sizeof(ruleobj) * n);
01042                     ls->rule[i] = string2rule(temp, &n);
01043                     ls->rulelength[i] = n;
01044                     i++;
01045                 }
01046             }
01047         }
01048         /* See if we've reached the end. */
01049         if (strchr(line, '}'))
01050         {
01051             ls->computed_f = 0;
01052             return;
01053         }
01054     }
01055 }
01056 
01057 
01058 int readfile(char *filename, lsystem ***pop, char ***names)
01059 {
01060     int error, n, i;
01061     FILE *fp = fopen(filename, "r");
01062     char line[LINE_LENGTH], *temp, **_names;
01063 
01064     if (!fp)
01065     {
01066         printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be opened\n", filename);
01067     }
01068 
01069     n = numLSystemsInFile(fp);
01070     _names = (char **)malloc(sizeof(char *)*n);
01071     *pop = (lsystem **)malloc(sizeof(lsystem *)*n);
01072     for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01073         (*pop)[i] = (lsystem *)malloc(sizeof(lsystem));
01074 
01075     i = 0;
01076     while (fgets(line, LINE_LENGTH, fp) != NULL)
01077     {
01078         if (line[0] != ';') /* Ignore comments. */
01079         {
01080             /* Search for newline character. */
01081             temp = strchr(line,'\n');
01082             /* Overwrite trailing newline.   */
01083             if (temp != NULL)
01084                 *temp = '\0';
01085             else
01086                 line[LINE_LENGTH - 1] = '\0';
01087 
01088             /* We look for the L-System by finding a '{' */
01089             temp = strchr(line, '{');
01090             if (temp)
01091             {
01092                 temp = strtok(line, " ");
01093                 _names[i] = (char *)malloc(strlen(temp));
01094                 strcpy(_names[i], temp);
01095                 readLSystem(fp, (*pop)[i]);
01096                 i++;
01097             }
01098         }
01099     }
01100 
01101     error = fclose(fp);
01102     if (error)
01103     {
01104         printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be closed\n", filename);
01105     }
01106 
01107     /* TODO: Rename the rules to "A,B,C,..." so that the crossover
01108        and mutation functions will work. */
01109 
01110     /*
01111     for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01112         print_ls((*pop)[i]);
01113     */
01114 
01115     *names = _names;
01116     return n;
01117 }
